data.value: In March 2013, AWAB was notified by the Brazilian Federal Revenue Office (RFB) that approximately $110 (R$220) of VAT credits previously claimed were disallowed with a 50% penalty assessed. In December 2019, AofA received a Statement of Audit Position (SOAP) from the Australian Taxation Office (ATO) regarding adjustments on historic third-party alumina sales, triggering income tax assessments and proposed penalties. Notices were received in July 2020, and formal objections lodged in September 2020. AofA’s dispute process involved administrative reviews and submission of evidence; proceedings were filed in the Australian Administrative Appeals Tribunal (AAT) in April 2022 with directions for further evidence filing.

The Notices asserted income tax of approximately $143 (A$214) plus compounded interest of about $474 (A$707), and proposed administrative penalties of around $86 (A$128). AofA paid 50% of the assessed tax during Q3 2020 with amounts recorded as prepaid tax assets and accrued tax liabilities, and further interest is accruing during the dispute process.

AWAB has presented its defense and continues disputing the disallowed credits, with potential recourse to litigation if administrative appeal fails. AofA has utilized statutory notices and lodged formal objections, and the dispute is now before the AAT with a set schedule for evidence submissions and replies.
